meanings.definition: (adjective) (of a disease) regularly found at a high or increased level in a specific population or geographic area
meanings.sent1: The hyperendemic flu outbreak affected many people in the town.
meanings.sent2: The region has been hyperendemic for malaria for years.
meanings.sent3: The hyperendemic chickenpox party was not as fun as expected.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperendemic fear of spiders made her avoid the basement at all costs.
meanings.sent5: The hyperendemic pollution in the city made breathing difficult for residents.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that indicates a high or increased level of a disease in a specific population or geographic area
meanings.sent1: The disease spread hyperendemically throughout the community.
meanings.sent2: The virus is spreading hyperendemically in the densely populated city.
meanings.sent3: He ran hyperendemically fast to catch the last bus of the night.
meanings.sent4: The news of the outbreak spread hyperendemically, causing panic among the residents.
meanings.sent5: The rumors about the illness circulated hyperendemically, causing confusion among the villagers.
